explanation: to confuse someone completely; to be too difficult or strange for someone to understand or explain
sentence: She was completely baffled by his strange behavior.
sentence_gap: She was completely _______ by his strange behavior.

explanation: a blue, brown, or purple mark that appears on the skin after someone has fallen, been hit, etc.
sentence: His arms and back were covered in bruises.
sentence_gap: His arms and back were covered in _______.

explanation: a written record of events in the order in which they happened
sentence: Her latest novel is a chronicle of life in a small town in North Carolina.
sentence_gap: Her latest novel is a _________ of life in a small town in North Carolina.

explanation: a quantity of goods that are sent or delivered somewhere
sentence: The most recent consignment of cloth was faulty.
sentence_gap: The most recent ___________ of cloth was faulty.

explanation: to get money illegally from a person or an organization by tricking them
sentence: All three men were charged with conspiracy to defraud.
sentence_gap: All three men were charged with conspiracy to _______.

explanation: to make a sudden, small movement because of pain or fear
sentence: He didn't even flinch when the nurse cleaned the wound.
sentence_gap: He didn't even ______ when the nurse cleaned the wound.

explanation: a small group of trees; a small area of land with fruit trees of particular types on it
sentence: Close to the mouth of the river was the sacred grove of the Italic goddess Marica.
sentence_gap: Close to the mouth of the river was the sacred _____ of the Italic goddess Marica.

explanation: to have a strong desire for something
sentence: I’ve been hankering for a hot dog.
sentence_gap: I’ve been _________ for a hot dog.

explanation: (disapproving) not having a strong taste or character, or having no interest or energy
sentence: Why anyone buys music with such insipid lyrics is a mystery.
sentence_gap: Why anyone buys music with such _______ lyrics is a mystery.

explanation: something that is covered in paper so that it can be sent by post
sentence: The parcel was wrapped in plain brown paper.
sentence_gap: The ______ was wrapped in plain brown paper.

explanation: having a row of sharp points along the edge
sentence: You really need a knife with a serrated edge for cutting bread.
sentence_gap: You really need a knife with a ________ edge for cutting bread.

explanation: (approving) (of people or their bodies) thin in an attractive or elegant way
sentence: He put his hands around her slender waist.
sentence_gap: He put his hands around her _______ waist.

explanation: a small stem with leaves on it from a plant or bush, used in cooking or as a decoration
sentence: Garnish the dish with sprigs of parsley.
sentence_gap: Garnish the dish with ______ of parsley.

translated: okazać się, wyjść na jaw, następować
explanation: formal; to become known or apparent; to take place; to be revealed
sentence: As it later transpired, she had known him at school.
sentence_gap: As it later __________, she had known him at school.

explanation: to disappear or stop being present or existing, especially in a sudden, surprising way
sentence: The child vanished while on her way home from school.
sentence_gap: The child ________ while on her way home from school.
